I don't think there are any `public` APIs for this at the moment, but we could expose them in a future Refresh if needed [based on feedback on the roadmap](https://roadmap.kentico.com/tabs/5-released).
In the meantime, I would recommend [using a taxonomy](https://docs.kentico.com/x/taxonomies_xp) instead of folders. The taxonomy is going to be more usable across Xperience - both in content management and delivery.
Taxonomies were designed for both administrative and presentational responsbilities, so it's fine to have a taxonomy that is only used by marketers to organize content.
Once you have your taxonomies defined, you can use [smart folders](https://docs.kentico.com/business-users/content-hub#smart-folders) to persist your taxonomy filters in the Content hub to make them easily accessible.
